DoingTasksIsPointlessInThisGameMode: Look, I see that you're a very diligent crewmate, but....\nDoing tasks is completely pointless in this game mode
ModeDescribe.HideAndSeek:
In the Hide And Seek gamemode, seekers have to kill all hiders, while hiders have to complete all tasks without being killed in order to win.
If the time limit reaches 0, hiders win.
If everyone apart from the Seekers die, the Seekers win.

Roles: Hider, Seeker, Fox, Troll, Jumper, Detector, Jet, Dasher, Locator, Venter, Agent, Taskinator
TimeDecreaseOnShortTaskComplete: When Completing a Short Task, Reduce the Game Time by
TimeDecreaseOnCommonTaskComplete: When Completing a Common Task, Reduce the Game Time by
TimeDecreaseOnLongTaskComplete: When Completing a Long Task, Reduce the Game Time by
TimeDecreaseOnSituationalTaskComplete: When Completing a Situational Task, Reduce the Game Time by
TimeDecreaseOnOtherTaskComplete: When Completing a Task That Doesn't Fit Any Category, Reduce the Game Time by
HiderInfo: Complete tasks and survive until the end
HiderInfoLong: Complete tasks and survive until the end
FoxInfo: Survive until the end to win
FoxInfoLong: Survive until the end to win
JumperInfo: Use vents to hide from Seekers
JumperInfoLong: Use vents to hide from Seekers
DetectorInfo: You know where the Seekers are
DetectorInfoLong: You know where the Seekers are
JetInfo: Pet to become fast and escape from Seekers
JetInfoLong: Pet to become fast and escape from Seekers
DasherInfo: Pet to become fast and catch Hiders
DasherInfoLong: Pet to become fast and catch Hiders
LocatorInfo: You get clues to find Hiders
LocatorInfoLong: You get clues to find Hiders
LocatorTargetKnows: Hiders know when they are located
LocatorNotify: A Locator is currently tracking you
PlayerAlreadyMod: This player is already a moderator, nothing was changed.
PlayerAddedToModList: Player successfully added to the moderator list.
PlayerRemovedFromModList: Player successfully removed from the moderator list.
PlayerNotMod: This player is not a moderator, nothing was changed.
PlayerAlreadyVIP: This player is already a VIP, nothing was changed.
PlayerAddedToVIPList: Player successfully added to the VIP list.
PlayerRemovedFromVIPList: Player successfully removed from the VIP list.
PlayerNotVIP: This player is not a VIP, nothing was changed.
GooseInfo: Honk at players to annoy them
GooseInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Goose, you can honk at players to annoy them. You can drag them around and make them unable to use their abilities while you're honking at them.
SimonInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs Simon, you can give instructions to players (Simon Says). Single click on someone to mark them, double click to kill to kill them. Vent to give out an instruction to all marked players. Players with kill buttons will be told to kill, while crewmates will be told to complete a task. If they don't follow the instruction until the next meeting, they will die. You can sabotage/pet to swap the instruction. This means, those who can, will be told to NOT kill, while crewmates will be told to NOT complete a task.
SimonKill: Simon says: <#ffff00>You must use your kill button before the next meeting</color>
SimonTask: Simon says: <#ffff00>You must complete a task before the next meeting</color>
SimonDontKill: Simon says: <#ffff00>You must NOT use your kill button until the next meeting</color>
SimonDontTask: Simon says: <#ffff00>You must NOT complete a task until the next meeting</color>
CatcherInfoLong:
(Crewmates):
As the Catcher, you can place traps by venting/petting. When a player steps on a trap, their role will be recorded. In the next meeting, you'll get a message of the list of roles caught in your trap.<size=80%>

Note: You don't know who stepped on your trap and who has which role.
You can place multiple traps, and you'll get a message of all roles caught in all traps.</size>
Catcher.TrapPlaceDelay: Trap Placement Delay (after venting) (if not using pets)
Catcher.MinPlayersTrappedToShowInfo: Minimum Number of Players Trapped to Show Info
Catcher.NotEnoughCaughtRoles: Not enough players have stepped on your traps to show the roles.
GeneratorInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Generator, you generate charges every second. You can only kill/vent/shapeshift/sabotage if you have enough charges to do so. You also lose charges while shapeshifted.
Generator.ChargesLostWhileShiftedPerSeco: Charges Lost While Shifted Per Second
Generator.Notify.RevertShapeshift: You ran out of charges, so shapeshifting was reverted
Generator.Notify.NotEnoughCharges: You don't have enough charges ({0}) to do that
GNoCommandInfo: This Command can only be used when in lobby or after you die. type /gno X to play guess a number. X can be a number between 0 and 99 (both included). You get maximum of 7 tries to guess the number. Example:- /gno 10
GNoLost: Oh, you were so close! Just one more guess, and you might have deciphered the Da Vinci code! By the way, <color=#ff0000>the secret number was... {0}!</color> But hey, you were only off by a few billion possibilities.  Better luck next time, Sherlock!
GNoLow: Oh, you're really nailing this! It's so low, I almost need a shovel to dig it up!\nYou have <color=#ff0000>{0} guesses</color> left!
GNoHigh: Oh, absolutely! You're getting warmer. In fact, it's so high, I need a telescope to see it from here! \nYou have <color=#ff0000>{0} guesses</color> left!
GNoWon: Oh, how did you ever figure that out? It's almost like you're a mind reader! Congratulations, you're a genius! You found the secret number with <color=#00ff00>{0} guesses</color> left!
BanditInfoLong:
(Neutral):
As the Bandit, use your kill button to steal a player's Addon. Depending on the settings, you may instantly steal the addon or after the meeting starts. After the max number of steals are reached you will be able to kill normally. Additionaly, if there are no stealable addons present on the target, you will the target.

Kill everyone to win.

Note: Cleansed and Last Impostor can not be stolen.
NegotiatorInfoLong: (Crewmates): As the Negotiator, you can negotiate with someone by voting for them in a meeting. Your target then has to choose between suiciding, receiving a harmful add-on, permanently getting low vision or low speed. If they don't pick, the default action is suicide. They can use /neg {index} to pick. You can only negotiate once per meeting. After the meeting, you'll know what your target picked.
Negotiator.MinVotingTimeLeftToNegotiate: Minimum Voting Time Left to Negotiate
Negotiator.TargetMessage: The Negotiator forced you to pick one of the following options (use /neg {index}, replacing {index} with the number shown before the option you want, e.g. /neg 1), or you die:\n
Negotiator.Title: <#ffff00>⚠ Negotiator ⚠</color>
CommanderInfoLong: (Impostors): As the Commander, you can switch between 6 modes by venting/petting. You can execute the selected action by shapeshifting. Mark: Marks your shapeshift target with a unique color visible to all impostors. Use this to command them to kill that player! Whistle: This tells all or 1 specific* impostor(s) to come to you and gives them (each) an arrow pointing towards you. Kill Anyone: Notifies all or 1 specific* impostor(s) to kill anyone. Leave Player Alive: Shapeshifting into a crewmate marks that player with a unique color and text telling other impostors to not kill that player. Shapeshifting into an impostor tells that impostor to not kill anyone. Don't Sabotage: Notifies all impostors to not call any sabotage. Use Ability: Notifies all or 1 specific* impostor(s) to use their ability. * If you shapeshift into an impostor, the action executes specifically and only on them.
CommanderNotify: The Commander wants you to meet with them
CommanderKillAnyoneNotify: Commander wants you to kill anyone
CommanderDontSabotageNotify: Commander wants you to not sabotage
CommanderUseAbilityNotify: Commander wants you to use your ability
CommanderDontKillAnyoneNotify: Commander wants you to not kill
CommanderDontKillMarkMode: Mark a Player to Leave Alive
CanOnlyUseWhileAnyWatch: Can Only Use Ability When There is a Device Usage Alert
AAWarning: <#ffff00>You must move away from this device or you die!</color>
AnchorInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou cannot be assigned any ghost roles.
BlockedInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou cannot move between vents. You can still enter and exit the same vent.
RoomRusherInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nYou're playing Room Rush. You have to get to the specified room as fast as possible, but always within the time limit, otherwise you die. You may be able to vent limited times depending on the host's settings. After you get to the specified room a certain amount of times successfully without dying, your win condition satisfies and you'll win with the winning team at the end.
RoomRusher.RoomsToWin: Number of rooms to get to for the win condition to satisfy
WizardInfoLong: (Crewmates): As the Wizard, you have 3 stats you can change for each player: Speed, Vision, and Kill Cooldown. Pet to cycle between these stats. Press Vanish to increase the value of the stat. To give the selected stat with its value to a player, use your kill button on them. Think twice before applying an effect, as it is permanent! You can override it by applying the same effect on them with a different value, but that removes another ability use!
Wizard.MinSpeedValue: Maximum Speed that can be given to players
Wizard.MinVisionValue: Maximum Vision that can be given to players
Wizard.MinKCDValue: Minimum Kill Cooldown that can be given to players
Wizard.MaxSpeedValue: Minimum Speed that can be given to players
Wizard.MaxVisionValue: Minimum Vision that can be given to players
Wizard.MaxKCDValue: Maximum Kill Cooldown that can be given to players
Wizard.SpeedStep: Step in which Speed is increased
Wizard.VisionStep: Step in which Vision is increased
Wizard.KCDStep: Step in which Kill Cooldown is increased
OxymanInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Oxyman, you have an Oxygen level below your name. The Oxygen level decreases overtime. You have to vent to increase your Oxygen. If the Oxygen level reaches 0%, you die. If it's very low, you're blind. If it's low, you're slower. If it's high, you're faster. If it's very high, you're invulnerable.
Oxyman.IncrementByVenting: On Venting, Oxygen Level Increases by
Oxyman.DecreasementEachSecond: Every Second, Oxygen Level Decreases by
BeehiveInfoLong:
(Neutrals):
As the Beehive, you can sting players by single clicking your kill button on them. Stung players will have a certain time to walk a certain distance (get away from your bees) (distance set by the host), or they die.
Double click on someone with your kill button to kill them normally.
Kill everyone to win.
Beehive.StungPlayersDieOnMeeting: Stung Players Die on Meeting Start
Beehive.Notify: <#ffff00>You were stung by the Beehive!\nWalk {0} units away from the Beehive in {1}s or you die!</color>
SpurtInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nWhen you start walking, you gain an enormous speed boost, which swiftly deteriorates, until you have to rest still for a while to rejuvenate your speed.
FragileInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nAs the Fragile, even if someone uses their kill button on you with a non-killing intent, they'll kill you anyway.
PhysicistInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nGrants portable vitals access for crewmate Roles.
FinderInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nGrants access to tracking players for crewmate roles.
ClairvoyantInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Clairvoyant, you can see the remaining impostor and neutral killer counts by entering a vent or petting.
SafeguardInfo: You Get a Temporary Shield by Completing Tasks
SafeguardInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Safeguard, you get a temporary shield with each task you complete.
TelekineticInfo: Execute Different Actions to Help the Crew
TelekineticInfoLong: (Crewmates): Sees a timer at all times. Dies if it gets above 60s. They can vent to change modes. They can only have one mode activated at a time. To execute an action, pet. Frozen for 5s after using some powers, timer is 40s after a meeting. Each action increases the timer by a certain amount when used (indicated next to the action name in the following list in brackets) Modes: Teleport Target: teleports the nearest player outside the map (+40s) Teleport Self: teleports themself outside the map (+30s) Freeze: freezes the nearest player (+35s) Kill: instantly kills the nearest player (+60s) Shield: gives them a shield lasting for some time (+45s) Speed: gives them increased speed for some time (+30s) Doors: opens all closed doors instantly (+35s)
NonplusInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Nonplus, you can blind others by venting or petting. Blinded players can't see anything for a set amount of time.\nKill everyone to win.
RookieInfo: You Can't Kill on the First Round
RookieInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou can't kill on the first round.
TraineeInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou can't vent, sabotage, shapeshift, or pet on the first round.
TraineeNotify: <#ffff00>As the <#4287f5>Trainee</color>, you can't vent, sabotage, shapeshift, or pet on the first round!</color>
SoothsayerInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Soothsayer, you can predict who kills you by voting them. If you're correct, when you die, everyone will be notified of the killer's identity.
SoothsayerDiedNotify: The Soothsayer predicted that {0} would kill them\nand they were correct!
VentriloquistInfo: Make Others Say What You Want
VentriloquistInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Ventriloquist, you can make others say what you want. First, type /target {id} to target a player. Then, type /chat {message} to make the targeted player say the message.
AugmenterInfo: Choose Who You Want to Kill
AugmenterInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Augmenter, you can shapeshift into someone to make them your target. The next time you attempt to kill someone, they will be swapped with your target and you will kill your target instead.
AugmenterFail: <#ffff44>Your attempt of murdering your target failed,\nso you've murdered your original target instead.</color>
InquirerInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Inquirer, you can check if a player has a specific role by typing /check {player id} {role}. There's a fail chance.
Inquirer.MessageTrue: <#00ff00>Correct! That player has the role you entered.
Inquirer.MessageFalse: <#ff0000>Incorrect! That player does not have the role you entered.
FreezerInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Freezer, you can shapeshift into a player to freeze them. The frozen player cannot move for a set amount of time.
PredatorInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Predator, you must kill one player that has one of the roles listed below your name. If you succeed to do so, you'll win with the winning team at the end. If you kill someone who doesn't have one of the roles listed below your name, you'll die.
NumOfRolesToKill: Amount of Roles to Choose From
MaxImpRolePicks: Maximum Number of Impostor Roles to Choose From
PredatorDone: You've done your job.\nYou'll win with the winning team at the end.
MarkseekerInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Markseeker, your first vote will mark the voting target as your target. When you die, the role of your target will be revealed to everyone.
TigerInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Tiger, you can sabotage/pet to become enraged. If you kill while you're enraged, the next closest player (within a radius) to your kill also dies.
RouleteGrandeurInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Roulette Grandeur, you can play Russian Roulette to reduce your kill cooldown after the next kill you make. Vent to cycle between the amount of risk (bullets) you put in. There are 5 slots. If you land on a bullet, you die. If you survive, your kill cooldown is permanately reduced by a set amount multiplied by the risk (bullets) you put in! Sabotage or pet to play a round with the chosen risk factor.
KCDReduction: Kill Cooldown Reduction (multiplied by the amount of bullets put in)
TankInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Tank, you must vent in every vent on the map. If you succeed to do so before the end of the game, you win with the winning team at the end. Otherwise, you lose. Your speed is significantly lower than others'.
GuessTank: According to the host's settings, the Tank cannot be guessed.
Tank.Suffix: <size=80%><#00ffa5>A random vent you haven't entered yet:</color> {0}</size>
RG.Hit: <#ffff00>The hit landed on one of your bullets!\nBetter luck next time!</color>
RG.NoHit: <#00ffa5>You survived, despite putting in <#8cffff>{0}</color> bullets.\nYour kill cooldown was reduced by <#8cffff>{1}s</color>!</color>
AgitaterInfoLong:
(Neutrals):
As the Agitator, your premise is essentially Hot Potato.

Use your kill button on a player to pass the bomb.
This can only be done once per round.

The player who receives the bomb will be notified when receiving said bomb, in which they need to pass it to another player by getting near a player.

When a meeting is called, the player with the bomb dies.

If trying to pass to Pestilence or a Veteran on alert, the bombed player dies instead.
Optionally, the Agitator cannot receive the bomb.
AgitaterTargetNotify: <size=110%><#ffff00>YOU HAVE THE BOMB!!</color>\n<#ffa500>Pass it to someone else or die!</color></size>
InvestorInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Investor, you can mark players using your kill button to invest in them. At the end, you win with the winning team if at least a set percentage of your marked players have won.
Investor.PercentNeed: Minimum Percentage of Winning Marked Players Needed to Win
CleanserRemovedRole: {0} has been cleansed. All their Addons will be removed after the meeting.
LostAddonByCleanser: All your Addons were removed by the {0}
CleanserInfo: Erase All Addons of your vote target
CleanserInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nCleanser can vote for any target at the meeting to erase the target's Add-ons, and the erasure will take effect after the meeting ends. Depending on the settings cleansed player may never get add on in future
CleansedInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nCleansed Add-on can only be obtained if cleanser erases all your Add-ons. Depending on the cleanser settings, you may not be able to obtain any more Add-ons in the future.
UnderdogMaximumPlayersNeededToKill: Maximum players needed for low cooldown
UnderdogKillCooldownWithMorePlayersAlive: Kill Cooldown when more players are alive
UnluckyTaskSuicideChance: Chance to suicide from doing tasks
UnluckyReportSuicideChance: Chance to suicide from reporting bodies
UnluckySabotageSuicideChance: Chance to suicide from opening a door
DiseasedCDReset: Cooldown returns to normal after a meeting
AntidoteCDReset: Cooldown returns to normal after a meeting
BomberCooldownsResetEachOther: Kill Cooldown & Bomb Cooldown Reset Each Other When Used
MinionInfoLong: (Impostor Ghost):\nAs the Minion, you can protect someone (optimally a crewmate) to blind them for a few seconds.
WardenInfoLong: (Crewmate Ghost):\nAs the Warden, you can protect someone (optimally a crewmate) to notify them about being in danger and to give them a temporary speed boost.
WardenNotify: The Warden warns you that you're in danger!
SpecterInfoLong: (Neutral Ghost):\nAs the Phantasm, you must finish all of your tasks to win! Depending on a setting, you may also end the game and win alone if you do so!
SnatchWin: Snatches Win (Win With Winning Team if Off)
BloodmoonInfoLong: (Impostor Ghost):\nAs the Bloodmoon, you can use your protect button on someone to make them die after a set amount of seconds. They know about this.
GAInfoLong: (Crewmate Ghost):\nAs the Guardian Angel, you can protect someone to save them from being killed. This is the vanilla Guardian Angel role, but as an add-on.
HaunterInfoLong: (Neutral Ghost):\nAs the Haunter, when you complete all of your tasks, a random living impostor's name will show in red to everyone in meetings. When you have 1 task left, all impostors will get an arrow pointing towards you, and if any of them come close to you, you lose this role.
Haunter1TaskLeft: <#ffff00>The Haunter has almost finished their tasks!\nGo near them or you might be revealed!</color>
HaunterRevealedYou: You have been revealed by the Haunter!
HaunterFinishedTasks: The Haunter completed all tasks, an impostor was revealed! (But it wasn't you)
HaunterStoppedSelf: <#ff1313>An impostor came too close to you, your role was removed.</color>
Haunter.TasksBeforeBeingKnown: Reveal Haunter When They've Completed This Many Tasks
Haunter.NumberOfReveals: Number of Players Revealed on Task Completion
RememberedCoven: You remembered you were a Coven member!
RememberedNeutralKiller: You remembered you were a neutral killer!
RememberedMaverick: You remembered you were a Maverick!
RememberedPursuer: You remembered you were a Pursuer!
RememberedTotocalcio: You remembered you were a Follower!
RememberedAmnesiac: You failed to remember your role.
RememberedImpostor: You remembered you were an Impostor!
RememberedCrewmate: You remembered you were a Crewmate!
RememberedLover: You remembered you were a Lover!
IncompatibleNeutralMode: If neutral is incompatible, turn into
ImmuneToAttacksWhenTasksDone: Immune to attacks on task completion
DoubleAgentInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Double Agent, you are an impostor among impostors. The real impostors see you as their partner, but you don't know who they are. Trick them into thinking you're one of their partners to expose them!
AbyssbringerInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Abyssbringer, you can place black holes. Black holes will suck in players and kill them when colliding with them.
Abyssbringer.Suffix: <size=80%><#00ffa5>Number of players consumed by</color> {0} <#00ffa5>active black holes:</color></size><size=70%>\n{1}
BlackHoleMovesTowardsNearestPlayer: Black Hole Moves Towards Nearest Player
SleepInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou sleep during lights out. You can't see anything, and you cannot move. You can only wake up when the lights are back on. If someone with the Glow add-on comes near you, you fully wake up and lose this add-on.
DecryptorInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Decryptor, each X tasks you complete (X is set by the host), you get to know one more letter from everyone's roles. You can see these characters below players' names. The letters are not in order and each letter only appears once for every occurance in the role name. Settings determine whether you can guess.
Decryptor.TaskNum: Number of Tasks to Complete for Each Letter
ParityCheckTargetKnow: Targets know they were checked by <color=#0D57AF>Inspector</color>
ParityCheckOtherTargetKnow: Targets know who they were checked with
ParityCopDead: You can not use your power after death
ParityCheckMax: Max inspections per game reached!\nYou can not use your power anymore.
ParityCheckRound: Max inspections per round reached!\nYou can check again in the next round.
ParityCheckSelf: HA!! you thought it would be this easy. You can not check yourself
ParityCheckSame: Bruh, did you seriously just compare a player to themselves?
ParityCheckReveal: HA! you thought it would be this easy. You can not check a role that is revealed
ParityCheckTrue: {0} and {1} are in the same team!"
ParityCheckFalse: {0} and {1} are NOT in the same team!
ParityCheckHelp:
Instructions: /cp [Player ID 1] [Player ID 2] 
Example: /cp 1 5 
You can see the player IDs before everyone's names 
 or use the /id command to list the player IDs
ParityCheckNull: Please select an ID of a living player to check their team
ParityCheckBaitCountMode: <color=#00f7ff>Bait</color> count as revealing role if <color=#00f7ff>Bait</color> reveal on first meeting is on
ParityCheckRevealTarget: When tasks done, target knows team of other target
ParityCopTargetReveal: Looks like {0} is aligned with team {1}
CopyCatResetToCopyCatEachRound: Reset role to <#ffb2ab>Copycat</color> after each meeting
CopyCatRoleChange: Your role has been changed to {0}
CopyCatAlreadyCopy: You have already copied a role in this round
CopyCatCanNotCopy: You can not copy target's role
CopyCrewVar: Can copy evil variants of crew roles
CouncillorDead: you can't murder from the dead."
CouncillorMurderMax: Sorry, you've reached the maximum amount of murders.
LaughToWhoMurderSelf: Hahaha, who would've thought someone was stupid enough to murder themselves?\n\nGuess it happens to be... YOU!
MisguessButNoSuicide: You guessed incorrectly so you.... WOULD have died if the host wasn't kind enough to disable guesser suicides!
MurderHelp: Command: /tl [player ID]\nYou can see the players' IDs before the players' names.\nOr use /id to view the list of all player IDs.
MurderNull: Please choose a living player to murder.
CouncillorMurderMaxMeeting: You cannot murder more players in this meeting. You've reached the limit set by the host.
DazzlerDazzled: You were dazzled by the Dazzler!
DazzlerDazzleLimit: Max number of players affected by reduced vision
DazzlerResetDazzledVisionOnDeath: Reset vision of dazzled players on death/eject
PawnInfo: Complete Tasks Then Pick Your Role
PawnInfoLong: (Neutrals): As the Pawn, you must complete all of your tasks, then use /choose {role} to pick your role. (Replace {role} with the name of the role that you want to become.) (You can only choose roles that are enabled.) You lose if you have this role when the game ends.
BlindInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou cannot see any arrows towards dead bodies and players.
ForgerInfoLong: (Impostors):\nAs the Forger, you can use /forge {id} {role} to change the specified player's role to the one you specifed after they die. Note that this will only be visual, the player will keep their actual role technically.
DealerInfoLong: (Neutrals):\nAs the Dealer, use your kill button to give players random add-ons. If you give a certain amount of add-ons, your win condition satisfy, and you'll win with the winning team at the end.
Dealer.AddonAppears: Add-ons Assign Target Sees the Add-on
Dealer.AssignNeedToWin: Number of Add-ons Needed to Give to Win
BatteryInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Battery, as long as you have at least 1 ability use when lights are called, it will be instantly fixed.<size=50%>\nIdea by: Raredeer</size>
BatteryNotify: <#ffa500>The lights sabotage cannot be called\nbecause there's a {0} alive</color>
PresidentInfoLong: (Crewmates): As the President, you have 6 decrees each to be used once in the game. You can only use 1 decree in every meeting. To use a decree, type /decree {number}, replacing {number} with the ID of the corresponding decree. To get a list of decrees and their IDs, type /decree. List of decrees and what they do: - Revealing: Reveals you as the President for everyone, makes you unguessable and cuts your vision in half for the rest of the game. - Finishing: Ends the current meeting instantly without counting the votes. - Declassification: Everyone will see voting colors at the end of the current meeting. - Government Support: Gives all crewmates +1 ability use. - Investigation: Get info about how many impostors and neutral killers are alive. - Government Recruiting: After using, vote for someone to recruit them (your vote will be canceled and you'll be able to vote normally after this) to recruit that player to the role specified in the settings, if they're a crewmate.
President.Help: Command: /decree {decree ID}\nYou can see the decree IDs by typing /decree
President.Recruit.TargetNotifyMessage: You have been recruited by the <#30916f>President</color>!
President.DecreeAlreadyUsedMessage: You have already used this decree or it isn't enabled!
President.DecreeAlreadyChosenThisMeeting: You have already chosen a decree this meeting!
GuessErased: You cannot guess a player's role that has been erased.

DadInfoLong:
(Crewmates):
As the dad, your life depends on alcohol. When you get attacked or voted out, you survive, but your alcohol decreases. Alcohol also decreases slowly over time. To increase your alcohol level, you have to get money from completing tasks and go to a random selected vent to buy a beer. Beer increases your alcohol level. When you finish all your tasks, you get new tasks, but you don't have to do them for task win. You don't know how much alcohol you have at the time. You only see warning when your alcohol level is low. Alcohol is counted in ‰.

You also have some abilities that are unlocked if you have enough alcohol. To use ability, switch between them using pet button and use selected one by venting:
<size=60%>- Going for milk: You go for milk. When you use it, you get teleported outside the map. You also can't discuss or vote in meetings. You can do nothing. You will come back with milk after exactly 10 years. When you come back, crewmates instantly win. When you use it, everyone will be informed about it.
- Super vision: You will have max vision for some time.
- Sniffing: You get arrows pointing to existing dead bodies after using it. Arrows only update when you sniff again.
- Sleep: During sleep people can't interact with you, but you can't see or move. During sleep you also cannot use any abilities and your alcohol is stable. You wake up when a meeting starts.
- Rage: You kill next person you see.
- Giving drink: You give all nearby players a drink. Every of these players will say their role in meeting with a chance of an incorrect result.
- Becoming god of alcohol: Resets your alcohol to 1‰, but your alcohol will increase instead of decreasing from now on.</size>
<size=70%>Every ability (except going for milk) will reduce your alcohol after using it.
If your alcohol reaches 0‰, you die.
Also, you see which abilities you can use. It can give you some more information about your alcohol level.
To make this role balanced, when someone attacks you, you lose alcohol after some time and not instantly.</size>

ToiletMasterInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Toilet Master, you can place toilets around the map. When a player uses a toilet, they will get a random effect based on their poop.

AstralInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Astral, you can vent/pet to become a ghost for a short time. After that, you will be revived.
HelperInfoLong: (Crewmates):\nAs the Helper, whenever you complete a task, a random crewmate will also have one of their tasks completed.

YouReceivedTheNecronomicon: You have received the <{0}>Necronomicon</color>! This grants you the ability to kill normally, and other abilities based on your role.
PlayerReceivedTheNecronomicon: {0} has received the <{1}>Necronomicon!\nNow, {2} Coven members have the Necronomicon: {3}
RegularCovenInfoLong: (Coven):\nYour previous Coven role was lost. You are now a regular Coven member. You still win with the Coven, but you don't have any abilities, cannot kill, and cannot get the Necronomicon.\nIf the Coven Leader dies, you become the new Coven Leader.
CovenLeaderInfoLong: (Coven):\nYou will always spawn if the Coven is enabled. You are the only Coven member who can directly kill. You gain the Necronomicon first. When your powers are enhanced by the Necronomicon, your kill cooldown is halved, and you gain a long kill distance.
SpellCasterInfoLong: (Coven):\nConjure hexes on players; when all players are hexed, the Coven wins after the next meeting if any Spellcasters are still alive (other players will know about this; you appear as hexed if more than half of the alive players are hexed). Upon gaining the Necronomicon, you will spell (like the Witch) all targets that are or become hexed.
SpellCaster.WinConditionMet: The Coven will win after this meeting if the {0} is still alive.
SpellCaster.WinConditionMetTitle: <#ffff00>⚠</color> The {0} has hexed all non-Coven players! <#ffff00>⚠</color>
PotionMasterInfo: Use potions to support the Coven
PotionMasterInfoLong: (Coven):\nUse potions on players to support the Coven. Using a potion on a Coven member gives them a medic shield. Using a potion on a non-Coven member reveals their role to all Coven members. Upon gaining the Necronomicon, instead of revealing roles, you kill non-Coven members.
PoacheInfo: Poison kills with delay or disables votes
PoacheInfoLong: (Coven):\nPoison a player, making them unable to vote in the next meeting. Players will not know they've been poisoned. Upon gaining the Necronomicon, poisoned players will die a few seconds (determined by the host's settings) after poisoning them.
ReaperInfoLong: (Coven):\nCurse a player; when a cursed player dies, you gain a soul. Upon reaching a specific number of souls (set by the host), you become Death. You cannot have the Necronomicon enhance your powers.
Reaper.SoulsRequired: Number of Souls required to transform into Death
DeathInfoLong: (Coven):\nYou cannot be killed normally and you have a low kill cooldown, similar to Pestilence. You cannot have the Necronomicon enhance your powers.
VoodooMasterInfoLong: (Coven):\nForce someone to use their ability on themselves or generally (like Tornado or Camouflager). Upon gaining the Necronomicon, you will also kill the target.
GoddessInfoLong: (Coven):\nUse a stone gaze (vanish button), causing anyone who interacts with you to die, much like a Veteran. Unlike a Veteran, all bodies will be stoned and cannot be reported. Upon gaining the Necronomicon, you can kill players directly, and they will still be stoned.
AugurInfoLong: (Coven):\nYou can guess players' roles during meetings. You cannot gain the Necronomicon, similar to a Reaper.
Augur.MaxGuessesPerMeeting: Max number of guesses per meeting
Augur.MaxGuessesPerGame: Max number of guesses per game
DreamweaverInfoLong: (Coven):\nWeave a player; woven players will become insane after the next meeting. Once insane, when they go near someone, they will immediately use their ability if their cooldown is up. Upon your death, all insane players will be freed. When enhanced by the Necronomicon, insane players will suicide after making contact with another player.
InsaneInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nInsane players were woven by the Dreamweaver. You are forced to use your ability on any player you touch as soon as your cooldown is up. If the Dreamweaver dies, you lose this add-on.
BansheeInfoLong: (Coven):\nScreech nearby players to deafen them (using the vanish button), making them unable to hear or see the chat during the next meeting. With the Necronomicon, your screech becomes lethal.
IllusionistInfoLong: (Coven):\nSample a player, then select another player (using Shapeshift) to morph them into the sampled player. Upon gaining the Necronomicon, you gain the ability to kill the sampled player (by double clicking with your kill button on them).
Illusionist.UnmorphPrevious: Unmorph previous target if a new one is chosen
TimelordInfoLong: (Coven):\nUse your ability on a Coven member to refresh their cooldown (set it to 0). Use your ability on a non-Coven member to reset their cooldown. When enhanced by the Necronomicon, you can kill and also reduce meeting time upon making a kill.
EnchanterInfoLong: (Coven):\nEnchant a player, making them appear as a Coven member to crew investigators. When an enchanted player is killed, their death reason will be random. When enhanced by the Necronomicon, you gain the ability to kill (by double clicking with your kill button on someone).
SirenInfoLong:
(Coven):
The Siren has an entrancing voice. Use the Sing ability (via the Vanish button) to affect nearby players.
- On the first hearing, non-Coven players are blinded and slowed for a short time.
- On the second, they are again blinded and slowed, and cannot report bodies temporarily.
- On the third, they become Entranced, converting to the Coven.

With the Necronomicon, the Siren gains the ability to kill normally, and her Sing is boosted by two stages:
- Players who've heard no songs are treated as if they've heard two.
- Players who've heard one song are treated as if they've heard three and become Entranced.
The Siren sees a tracker near each player's name showing their current stage (0/3, 1/3, 2/3, Entranced).
EntrancedInfoLong: (Add-ons):\nYou are a non-Coven player who has been entranced by the Siren. You are now on the Coven team and win with them at the end.
WyrdInfo: Mark players; doom triggers on action.
WyrdInfoLong:
(Coven):
The Wyrd manipulates destiny by marking players with Fate’s Countdown. Marked players share a hidden countdown that begins when the first player is marked. Once the countdown expires, any marked player who tries to complete a task, report a body, or press the meeting button will instantly die.

The Wyrd can only mark a certain number of players at a time. To mark someone, shapeshift into them.
When 2 or more players are marked, they can see the countdown.

With the Necronomicon, the Wyrd can kill directly using the kill button.

Notes:
All marked players share the same countdown.
A small bonus to the countdown is added for each additional marked player.
The countdown pauses during meetings.
Wyrd.BlockMeetingOnDeath: Block Meeting If The Marked Player Died due to the above settings
